general_advisory: As per extended range of forecast received from IMD, Maximum temperature likely to be above normal by 3 to 5Â°C over the districts of Odisha during week -1 (12th to 18th April 2024). Farmers are advised to plan for farming activities accordingly. Considering the weather forecast, it is advised to resume application of plant protection chemicals & fertilizer from day after tomorrow. Farmers are advised to undertake weeding and hoeing operation in the standing crops and vegetables to protect them from weeds by utilizing available soil moisture. Use light trap to monitor insect population.

advisory: Sheath Blight: Apply Azoxystrobin 11% + Tebuconazole 18.3% @ 1.5 ml/ltr of water for effective control.
Bacterial Blight: Apply Copper oxychloride 50% WP @ 3 g/liter of water.
Blast: If infestation of blast disease is noticed, spray Carbendazim 50 WP @ 1g/ltr of water or Trifloxystrobin 25% + Tebuconazole 50% @ 4 g /10 ltrs of water or Edifenphos 50 EC @ 1 ml/ltr of water.

Stem borer/Leaf folder: Apply Cartap hydrochloride 4G @ 10 kg/acre mixing with sand at 1:1 ratio or spray Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC @ 3ml or Flubendiamide 39.35% M/M SC @ 1ml by mixing with 10 liters of water to control stem borer/leaf folder infestation.
Harvest pods at 70-80% maturity and sundry to bring moisture content to 8-10% of the seed.
Store harvested produce by mixing with Mustard oil @ 2ml/kg seeds to protect from stored grain pests.
Provide a light irrigation just before harvest to facilitate easier removal of matured pods from the soil.
Leave pods along with plants for drying for 5-7 days after uprooting to improve grain weight.
Powdery mildew: Apply Sulphur 80% WP @ 4g/ltr of water if symptoms are noticed.
Powdery mildew: Apply Carbendazim 50% WP @ 0.5g/ltr of water if symptoms are noticed.
Avoid moisture stress during bulb formation stage.
Stop irrigating the crop 15 days before harvest. Store harvested onion in a well-ventilated room to prevent sprouting.
Purple blotch: Spray Difenoconazole 25% EC or Tebuconazole 25.9% EC or Kitazin 48% EC @ 1g/ltr of water.
Thrips: Install blue sticky traps @ 8/acre at vegetative stage. For chemical control, spray Thiomethoxam 25 WG @ 1g/5 liters of water or Acetamiprid 20% SP @ 1g/4 liters of water.
Do not allow draught animals to work in the sun after 10 AM. Allow grazing after 4 PM. Provide clean and cool water.
Allow grazing only from 7-10 AM and 4-7 PM. Keep the shed curtains closed during the day and open at night for air passage.
Keep the poultry shed cool during rising temperatures. Sprinkle water for cooling effect if necessary. Provide optimal feed and water to avoid heat stress. Keep the curtains closed during the day.
